indications.text: mycophenolate mofetil ( mmf ) indicated prophylaxis organ rejection , adult pediatric recipients 3 months age older allogeneic kidney [ ( 14.1 ) ] , heart [ ( 14.2 ) ] liver transplants [ ( 14.3 ) ] , combination immunosuppressants .

contraindications.text: adults kidney transplant 1 g twice daily , orally ( 2.2 ) heart transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally ( 2.3 ) liver transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally ( 2.4 ) pediatrics kidney transplant 600 mg/m 2 twice daily , maximum 2 g daily ( 2.2 ) heart transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily ( starting dose ) maximum 900 mg/m 2 twice daily ( 2.3 ) liver transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily ( starting dose ) maximum 900 mg/m 2 twice daily ( 2.4 ) reduce interrupt dosing event neutropenia . ( 2.5 ) full prescribing information ( fpi ) : adjustments renal impairment neutropenia ( 2.5 ) .

adverseReactions: allergic mycophenolate mofetil observed ; therefore , mycophenolate mofetil contraindicated patients hypersensitivity mycophenolate mofetil ( mmf ) , mycophenolic acid ( mpa ) component product .
name: Mycophenolate mofetil
indications_original: Mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) is indicated for the prophylaxis of organ rejection, in adult and pediatric recipients 3 months of age and older of allogeneic kidney [see Clinical Studies (14.1)], heart [see Clinical Studies (14.2)] or liver transplants [see Clinical Studies (14.3)], in combination with other immunosuppressants.
contraindications_original: ADULTS DOSAGE Kidney Transplant 1 g twice daily, orally (2.2) Heart Transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally (2.3) Liver Transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally (2.4) PEDIATRICS Kidney Transplant 600 mg/m 2 twice daily, up to maximum of 2 g daily (2.2) Heart Transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily (starting dose) up to a maximum of 900 mg/m 2 twice daily (2.3) Liver Transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily (starting dose) up to a maximum of 900 mg/m 2 twice daily (2.4) Reduce or interrupt dosing in the event of neutropenia. (2.5) See full prescribing information (FPI) for: adjustments for renal impairment and neutropenia (2.5).
adverseReactions_original: Allergic reactions to mycophenolate mofetil have been observed; therefore, mycophenolate mofetil is contraindicated in patients with a hypersensitivity to mycophenolate mofetil (MMF), mycophenolic acid (MPA) or any component of the drug product.
